title: Barcelona and Real Madrid take El Clasico to Florida this summer, International Champions Cup officials confirm
text:

Spanish giants Barcelona and Real Madrid will meet in a pre-season friendly in the United States this summer. 
The bitter rivals have announced that they will face off as part of the International Champions Cup series on July 29, with the game taking place in Miami, Florida. 
The pair will meet at the Hard Rock Stadium, home of the Miami Dolphins. 
It will be the first time that they meet on US soil and only the second time they have met outside Spain - the previous occasion being 35 years ago, in Venezuela, when Los Blancos won 1-0. 
Organisers are planning for the fixture to be the highlight of a weekend-long series of festivities, including concerts and a legends match. The old foes will do battle once more (Photo: 2016 Getty Images) 
Stadium executives and team officials from both clubs announced details for the clash on Miami Beach on Friday. 
As part of the launch, thousands of balls with logos of both teams were dropped at parks across South Florida. 
The ICC has grown into a major part of pre-season for a host of Europe's biggest clubs, with matches across the globe. 
Last summer saw PSG, Barcelona, Chelsea, Leicester, Liverpool and Celtic all take part. A total of 800,000 fans attended matches.
